member.name: M:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.summary: Enumeration of message response acknowledgements. This is a simple enumerated values indicating success of failure.

member.name: T:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.PersistType
member.summary:
Enumeration of database persistence actions. (Also called CRUD operations: Create, Read, Update, Delete).
SOA Design Pattern: Command Message. Basically this in an instruction or command to the receiver which operatin to execute.

member.name: T:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.RequestBase
member.summary: Base class for all client request messages of the web service. It standardizes communication between web services and clients with a series of common values. Derived request message classes assign values to these variables. There are no default values.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.RequestBase.ClientTag
member.summary: Each web service request carries a security token as an extra level of security. Tokens are issued when users are coming online. They can expire if necessary. Google.com and Amazon.com uses this in their API.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.RequestBase.AccessToken
member.summary: Each web service request carries a security token as an extra level of security. Tokens are issued when users are coming online. They can expire if necessary. Google.com and Amazon.com uses this in their API.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.RequestBase.Version
member.summary: Minimum version number that client request is required to run under. This facilitates a certain level of backward compatibility for when the web service API evolves. Ebay.com uses the version number in their API.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.RequestBase.RequestId
member.summary: A unique number (ideally a Guid) issued by the client representing the instance of the request. Avoids rapid-fire processing of the same request over and over in denial-of-service type attacks.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.RequestBase.LoadOptions
member.summary: Load options indicated what types are to be returned in the request.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.RequestBase.Action
member.summary: Crud action: Create, Read, Update, Delete

member.name: T:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.ResponseBase
member.summary: Base class for all response messages to clients of the web service. It standardizes communication between web services and clients with a series of common values and their initial defaults. Derived response message classes can override the default values if necessary.

member.name: M:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.ResponseBase.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded Constructor for ResponseBase. Sets CorrelationId from incoming Request.
member.param: The correlation identifier for request and response.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.ResponseBase.Acknowledge
member.summary: A flag indicating success or failure of the web service response back to the client. Default is success. Ebay.com uses this model.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.ResponseBase.CorrelationId
member.summary: CorrelationId mostly returns the RequestId back to client.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.ResponseBase.Message
member.summary: Message back to client. Mostly used when a web service failure occurs.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.ResponseBase.ReservationId
member.summary: Reservation number issued by the web service. Used in long running requests. Also sometimes referred to as Correlation Id. This number is a way for both the client and web service to keep track of long running requests (for example, a request to make a reservation for a airplane flight).

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.ResponseBase.Version
member.summary: Version number (in major.minor format) of currently executing web service. Used to offer a level of understanding (related to compatibility issues) between the client and the web service as the web services evolve over time. Ebay.com uses this in their API.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.ResponseBase.Build
member.summary: Build number of currently executing web service. Used as an indicator to client whether certain code fixes are included or not. Ebay.com uses this in their API.

member.name: F:Epi.Web.SurveyAPI.Web.Common.MessageBase.ResponseBase.RowsAffected
member.summary: Number of rows affected by "Create", "Update", or "Delete" action.
